slides.title: What is Neuroplasticity?
slides.content: Neuroplasticity, also known as brain plasticity, refers to the brain's ability to change and adapt its structure and function throughout a person's life. This includes creating new neural connections, strengthening or weakening existing connections, and reorganizing neural networks in response to new experiences, learning, and even injury.

slides.title: Benefits of Neuroplasticity
content: Support for mental health and well-being
